title: Calrik Privacy Policy: Safeguarding Your Data and Confidentiality
content:
If you use or access the calrik.com website, click on the "Create an Account" button, or use any of the services, you accept that you have read, understood, and accept this privacy policy which you understand is part of the Term of Service.

This website, along with all associated sites, domains, materials, information, software, SaaS, applications, and services are owned, operated, and maintained by CameraReadyArt Inc. (hereinafter "CRA"), 6303 Owensmouth Ave., 10th Floor, Woodland Hills, CA 91367.

With respect to your private information, CRA is the "Data Controller" under the General Data Protection Regulation 2016/679 of the European Union. As part of our general terms of service (“TOS”), we have developed this transparent and clear privacy policy (“Privacy Policy”) that explains how we collect, use, protect, and disclose your Personal Data (as defined below) and data when you use the Calrik website at calrik.com and all related sites, domains, materials, information, software, software-as-a-service, applications, and services (collectively, the "Services"). The Privacy Policy also explains what choices you have for managing your information preferences and opting out of certain uses of your Personal Data.

Interpretation & Definitions

The words of which the initial letter is capitalized have meanings defined under the following conditions. The following definitions shall have the same meaning regardless of whether they appear in the singular or in the plural.

For the purposes of this Privacy Policy:

Account means a unique account created for You to access our Service or parts of our Service.

Company (referred to as either "the Company", "We", "Us" or "Our" in this Agreement) refers to CameraReadyArt Inc. (hereinafter "CRA"), 6303 Owensmouth Ave., 10th Floor, Woodland Hills, CA 91367.

Cookies are small files that are placed on Your computer, mobile device or any other device by a website, containing the details of Your browsing history on that website among its many uses.

Country refers to California, United States

Device means any device that can access the Service such as a computer, a cellphone, or a digital tablet.

Personal Data is any information that relates to an identified or identifiable individual.

Service refers to the Website.

Service Provider means any natural or legal person who processes the data on behalf of the Company. It refers to third-party companies or individuals employed by the Company to facilitate the Service, to provide the Service on behalf of the Company, to perform services related to the Service, or to assist the Company in analyzing how the Service is used.

Third-party Social Media Service refers to any website or any social network website through which a User can log in or create an account to use the Service.

Usage Data refers to data collected automatically, either generated by the use of the Service or from the Service infrastructure itself (for example, the duration of a page visit).

Website refers to calrik.com, accessible from https://www.calrik.com

You means the individual accessing or using the Service, or the company, or other legal entity on behalf of which such individual is accessing or using the Service, as applicable.

1. Who is collecting and/or processing your data?

We collect and/or process your data.

Data Controller: We collect some personal data from you, such as when you visit Our website, provide us reviews or feedback, try a free service, download a free resource and contact us or send an inquiry for any information.

In this case, We are the data controller for purposes of European data protection legislation, & We take on the obligations & responsibilities of data controllers, particularly described in the General Data Protection Regulation. We do not sell, rent or share your personal information with any third parties in any way other than disclosed in this privacy policy.

2. What personal data the Company collects and process?

The term “personal data” in this Privacy Policy is the information that relates to you and allows us to identify you, either directly or in combination with other information that we may hold. Your personal data may include for example your name, your contact details (name and email), your payment details, or information on how you use Our website.

When you provide personal data through Our website, you consent to the Company usage of provided data in accordance with this Privacy Policy and/or any additional agreement between you and the Company.

The Company may collect and process the following categories of information about you:

Your contact details (name, email)
  • When you log in or create an account at Our Website
  • When you request Our Website demonstration or trial
  • When you subscribe to emails or newsletters
  • When you register for Website webinars
  • When you send a request for technical support
Your payment details (credit card number, expiry date, etc.)
  • When you purchase/subscriber to Our services
  • When you validate your payment details
Your IP, cookies
  • When you visit Our website
  • When you use Our services
  • When you visit our landing pages hosted on third-party services
The communications you exchange with Us (for example, your emails, calls, or your messages on Our website online chat service)
  • When you contact Us or you are contacted by Us on our online chat or email messages
Your posts and messages on social media directed to Us
  • When you interact with Us on social media through messages or via chat, comments
Your feedback
  • When you leave us feedback, social media reviews, or comments on blogs or any online resources
Information about how you use our website
  • When you navigate on our website

Depending on the activity, some of the information that we ask for can be mandatory and some can be optional. Without providing the mandatory data with respect to the particular activity, you will be unable to engage or receive the desired service or information.

By buying/subscribing to some of our services you may be providing us with access to certain third-party solutions, software, or services to carry on.

3. Automatically Collected Information

We and third parties may use automated means to collect information about you, your computer or any other device you may use to visit our website.

These automated means include technologies such as cookies, web server logs, web beacons, and JavaScript.

4. Third-Party Links and Services

Occasionally and at our discretion, we place links to third-party websites, applications, or services as well as embedded images or other third-party content on our website. Your clicks on these links may result in the collection, processing, or sharing of your information with the relevant third parties wherein we are not responsible or hold any control over their data collection and processing practices. The information you share or provide to these third parties is not covered under our privacy policy.

5. Rights of data subjects

You have a right to access, modify, correct or delete certain personal data we hold about you. You may exercise those rights in your settings, in the “Profile” section, or by contacting us via legal@calrik.com.

We will attend to your request at the soonest, however in any case it may take at least 30 calendar days from the date of receipt of the request.

We may keep certain information even after you close your account if necessary to comply with our legal obligations, meet regulatory requirements, resolve disputes, and prevent fraud and abuse. We may keep your data in published or unpublished format on the website or in backups of the website.

If you have a question on how We use and protect your data, please reach out to our data protection officer at legal@calrik.com.

6. How your personal information is used?

  • Create and manage your account on our Website
  • Tailor our services by taking into account your needs and preferences
  • To provide and deliver the services as well as technical support
  • To send a marketing communication, provide customer support and build the relationship
  • To Process your financial transactions
  • Send order/payment received/payment due confirmations
  • Respond to customer questions and concerns
  • Send quotation or information about requested service or inquiry
  • Keep you informed about the latest free resources, new services, and offers
  • Administer promotions and sweepstakes you participate in and notify the results
  • To improve and personalize the user experience for visitors and customers
  • Provide tailored advertising via Google Adwords, Facebook book ads

7. Security of your data

We committed to take appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorized and unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction, or damage to your personal data

As a measure of security to protect your personal data your information is stored behind secured networks which can be assessed only by limited personnel who have special rights to such systems and are bounded to keep the information safe and confidential.

Additionally, all your information is encrypted using a Secure Socket Layer (SSL).

8. Term for data storage

We will delete your personal data within 30 calendar days of receiving your request for data erasure.

We reserve its right to retain a part of personal data, which is required by applicable law and for the term, required by applicable law (e.g., applicable law may require that some personal data shall be retained for tax accounting or for issuing the invoice for unpaid fees).

9. Cookies or other tracking technologies

This Website may automatically collect information as you browse such as the internet service provider, browser type and version, Operating system, device type, average time spent, pages viewed, Internet protocol (IP) address used to connect your computer to the internet, and any other such relevant statistics.

Technologies such as cookies, beacons, tags, or scripts are used by Us, analytics services. It is used to analyze trends, administer site performance, track user movements around the site, and other demographic information about our user base. We may receive reports based on the use of these technologies by these companies.

What cookies do We use?

We use the following types of cookies:

  • Essential cookies, which are essential for the provision of access to our websites and Services;
  • Functionality cookies, which are used to personalize the content in accordance with your actions on our website;
  • Performance cookies, which do not identify you individually (until you enter your identification details in any of our forms) but help us to evaluate the website performance and its statistics; and targeting/advertising cookies, which help advertise Us offers and services on the other sites.

We also use analytics and similar services that collect third-party cookies:

  • Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google AdWords & Double Click (Google Privacy Policy is available at https://policies.google.com/technologies/ads?hl=en, text and URL may be changed by Google sole discretion),
  • Facebook & Facebook Pixel (Facebook Privacy Policy is available at https://www.facebook.com/policy.php, text and URL may be changed by Facebook sole discretion),
  • Tawk.to (Tawk.to privacy policy is available at https://www.tawk.to/privacy-policy/, text and URL may be changed by Tawk.to's sole discretion

How to reject or delete cookies?

  • Majority of the browsers automatically accept cookies. However, you may choose to allow cookies at any time, or even reject, or delete all the cookies stored on your device.
  • You can find out how to do this for your particular browser by clicking Help on your browser's menu.
  • If you choose to turn off cookies, the functionality of our Services may be limited.

10. Revisions

We may make changes & updates to this Privacy Policy from time to time, without advance notice. Any modifications will be effective from the time they are posted on our Website.

11. Contact information

  • Questions, comments, and requests regarding this privacy policy are welcomed and should be addressed to legal@calrik.com.
  • You may also send your request to our data protection officer at legal@calrik.com.
  • This document was last updated on February 01, 2022
